Corporate Finance Manager Job at Sahara Group




        
    

        
        Sahara Group is a leading international energy and infrastructure conglomerate with operations in over 38 countries across Africa, Middle East, Europe and Asia. Spanning three decades, we have broken ground and challenged stereotypes across the global business landscape. The women and men who make up our organization are our strongest levers for growth.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Corporate Finance Manager

Job Identification: 377
Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full Time

Role Accountabilities
Financial/Investment Analysis:
     

            
    




	Ability to critically analyze sector development for financial impact on the business.
	Provide economic & financial impacts of planned investments/opportunities for decision making.
	Identify opportunities to earn a rate of return on a capital investment which is greater than the cost of capital.
	Negotiate and structure financial deals.
	Assess and predict financial risks and returns.


Project Financing:


	Using Financial Models to determine optimal funding for Capital Investments and valuation.
	Optimization of SPG’s capital structure.
	Lead competitive bid proposals and formal presentations.
	Debt Funding
	Provide a balance in the source of funding between equity and debt.
	Manage Sahara Power Debt Portfolio.
	Advise on optimum financial funding arrangement.
	Strong knowledge of capital market and other debt lenders.


Other Roles:


	Assist with Investment opportunity. 
	Due Diligence preparation.
	Structuring financial and power sector deals.
	Liaising with all parties involved in financial transactions and ensuring interest are aligned.
	Providing strategic insight and knowledge to shape the financial direction.
	Liaise with accountants, lawyers, financial experts and regulatory bodies.


Requirements


	A minimum of 5 to 8 years of relevant experience 
	Experience in the financial sector/Banking industry
	Strong financial analysis and modelling skills
	Excellent reporting skills
	Decision making skills
	Proven track record
	Interpersonal relationship skills
	Team Management Skills
	Professional Certification (ACA/ ACCA) or CFA


Working Relationships:


	Executive Directors
	Managing Directors and Business Heads
	Finance Team
	Bankers
	Capital Market players

Human Resources Executive Job at Western Buckland Limited




        
    

        
        Western Buckland Limited, a Telecommunications company, is recruiting suitable candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources Executive

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos

Summary
     

            
    




	Are you passionate about creating a workplace where people thrive? Do you have what it takes to balance employee well-being with business objectives? If you’re a forward-thinking HR professional with 3–5 years of progressive experience, we want you on our team.
	At Western Buckland, we don’t just fill roles — we build people, culture, and systems that power business success.


Your Core Responsibilities


	Champion HR strategies that support talent retention and company growth.
	Oversee full-cycle recruitment, onboarding, and succession planning.
	Drive employee engagement and performance improvement initiatives.
	Ensure legal compliance and timely documentation of all HR processes.
	Partner with leadership to align HR with business goals.
	Maintain and improve HR systems, analytics, and workforce planning tools.
	Promote a culture of learning, development, and accountability.


What You Must Have


	Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources, Business Admin, or related field.
	3 - 5 years of progressive HR experience, ideally in a fast-paced environment.
	Strong knowledge of Nigerian labor law and HR compliance standards.
	Working knowledge of HR software (HRIS) and reporting tools.
	CIPM membership or other recognized HR certification preferred.
	Excellent communication, conflict resolution, and people management skills.


Who We’re Looking For:
An HR Executive who is not just experienced, but:


	Strategic: You think beyond payroll and policies.
	Empathetic: You value people and workplace harmony.
	Process-Oriented: You believe structure creates freedom.
	Driven: You proactively spot gaps and close them.


Salary
N250,000 monthly. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a short cover letter (telling us what drives their passion for HR) to: conuoha@westernbuckland.com and copy recruitments@westernbuckland.com  using "HR Executive" as the subject of the email.

  "description": "Choice Talents NG is Nigeria&rsquo;s preferred talents management company. Our goal is to help build successful businesses through effective talent, resource and process management.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Banking Sales Agent

Job Locations:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT) and Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the role
